segment.source: A tooltip is a short description that is linked to another control or object.
segment.target: A tooltip is a short description that is linked to another control or object.

segment.source: Tooltips help users understand unfamiliar objects that aren't described directly in the UI.
segment.target: Tooltips help users understand unfamiliar objects that aren't described directly in the UI.

segment.source: They display automatically when the user moves focus to, presses and holds, or hovers the mouse pointer over a control.
segment.target: They display automatically when the user moves focus to, presses and holds, or hovers the mouse pointer over a control.

segment.source: The tooltip disappears after a few seconds, or when the user moves the finger, pointer or keyboard/gamepad focus.
segment.target: The tooltip disappears after a few seconds, or when the user moves the finger, pointer or keyboard/gamepad focus.

segment.source: Tooltips should be used sparingly, and only when they are adding distinct value for the user who is trying to complete a task.
segment.target: Tooltips should be used sparingly, and only when they are adding distinct value for the user who is trying to complete a task.

segment.source: One rule of thumb is that if the information is available elsewhere in the same experience, you do not need a tooltip.
segment.target: One rule of thumb is that if the information is available elsewhere in the same experience, you do not need a tooltip.

segment.source: A valuable tooltip will clarify an unclear action.
segment.target: A valuable tooltip will clarify an unclear action.

segment.source: When should you use a tooltip?
segment.target: When should you use a tooltip?

segment.source: To decide, consider these questions:
segment.target: To decide, consider these questions:

segment.source: Should info become visible based on pointer hover?
segment.target: Should info become visible based on pointer hover?

segment.source: If not, use another control.
segment.target: If not, use another control.

segment.source: Display tips only as the result of user interaction, never display them on their own.
segment.target: Display tips only as the result of user interaction, never display them on their own.

segment.source: Does a control have a text label?
segment.target: Does a control have a text label?

segment.source: If not, use a tooltip to provide the label.
segment.target: If not, use a tooltip to provide the label.

segment.source: It is a good UX design practice to label most controls inline and for these you don't need tooltips.
segment.target: It is a good UX design practice to label most controls inline and for these you don't need tooltips.

segment.source: Toolbar controls and command buttons showing only icons need tooltips.
segment.target: Toolbar controls and command buttons showing only icons need tooltips.

segment.source: Does an object benefit from a description or further info?
segment.target: Does an object benefit from a description or further info?

segment.source: If so, use a tooltip.
segment.target: If so, use a tooltip.

segment.source: But the text must be supplemental — that is, not essential to the primary tasks.
segment.target: But the text must be supplemental — that is, not essential to the primary tasks.

segment.source: If it is essential, put it directly in the UI so that users don't have to discover or hunt for it.
segment.target: If it is essential, put it directly in the UI so that users don't have to discover or hunt for it.

segment.source: Is the supplemental info an error, warning, or status?
segment.target: Is the supplemental info an error, warning, or status?

segment.source: If so, use another UI element, such as a flyout.
segment.target: If so, use another UI element, such as a flyout.

segment.source: Do users need to interact with the tip?
segment.target: Do users need to interact with the tip?

segment.source: If so, use another control.
segment.target: If so, use another control.

segment.source: Users can't interact with tips because moving the mouse makes them disappear.
segment.target: Users can't interact with tips because moving the mouse makes them disappear.

segment.source: Do users need to print the supplemental info?
segment.target: Do users need to print the supplemental info?

segment.source: If so, use another control.
segment.target: If so, use another control.

segment.source: Will users find the tips annoying or distracting?
segment.target: Will users find the tips annoying or distracting?

segment.source: If so, consider using another solution — including doing nothing at all.
segment.target: If so, consider using another solution — including doing nothing at all.

segment.source: If you do use tips where they might be distracting, allow users to turn them off.
segment.target: If you do use tips where they might be distracting, allow users to turn them off.

segment.source: Recommendations
segment.target: Recommendations

segment.source: Use tooltips sparingly (or not at all).
segment.target: Use tooltips sparingly (or not at all).

segment.source: Tooltips are an interruption.
segment.target: Tooltips are an interruption.

segment.source: A tooltip can be as distracting as a pop-up, so don't use them unless they add significant value.
segment.target: A tooltip can be as distracting as a pop-up, so don't use them unless they add significant value.

segment.source: Keep the tooltip text concise.
segment.target: Keep the tooltip text concise.

segment.source: Tooltips are perfect for short sentences and sentence fragments.
segment.target: Tooltips are perfect for short sentences and sentence fragments.

segment.source: Large blocks of text can be overwhelming and the tooltip may time out before the user has finished reading.
segment.target: Large blocks of text can be overwhelming and the tooltip may time out before the user has finished reading.

segment.source: Create helpful, supplemental tooltip text.
segment.target: Create helpful, supplemental tooltip text.

segment.source: Tooltip text must be informative.
segment.target: Tooltip text must be informative.

segment.source: Don't make it obvious or just repeat what is already on the screen.
segment.target: Don't make it obvious or just repeat what is already on the screen.

segment.source: Because tooltip text isn't always visible, it should be supplemental info that users don't have to read.
segment.target: Because tooltip text isn't always visible, it should be supplemental info that users don't have to read.

segment.source: Communicate important info using self-explanatory control labels or in-place supplemental text.
segment.target: Communicate important info using self-explanatory control labels or in-place supplemental text.

segment.source: Use images when appropriate.
segment.target: Use images when appropriate.

segment.source: Sometimes it's better to use an image in a tooltip.
segment.target: Sometimes it's better to use an image in a tooltip.

segment.source: For example, when the user hovers over a hyperlink, you can use a tooltip to show a preview of the linked page.
segment.target: For example, when the user hovers over a hyperlink, you can use a tooltip to show a preview of the linked page.

segment.source: Don't use a tooltip to display text already visible in the UI.
segment.target: Don't use a tooltip to display text already visible in the UI.

segment.source: For example, don't put a tooltip on a button that shows the same text of the button.
segment.target: For example, don't put a tooltip on a button that shows the same text of the button.

segment.source: Don't put interactive controls inside the tooltip.
segment.target: Don't put interactive controls inside the tooltip.

segment.source: Don't put images that look like they are interactive inside the tooltip.
segment.target: Don't put images that look like they are interactive inside the tooltip.
